marketNews.title: The Fed Signals Delay in Interest Rate Cuts, Rupiah Weakens
marketNews.content: The Fed Head, Jerome Powell, signaled that the start of US interest rate cuts will take longer than expected as inflation is outpacing expectations and the labor market conditions remain strong. Powell also stated that if inflationary pressures continue, the Fed may keep interest rates stable for as long as necessary. In March 2024, the US recorded 3.5% YoY inflation (vs. February 2024: 3.2% inflation), exceeding the consensus expectation of 3.4%. This result marked the third consecutive time the inflation rate was higher than expected. This inflationary pressure strengthens the narrative that US interest rates will remain at a high level for longer ('higher for longer'). Based on analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of the Fed cutting interest rates at the June 2024 meeting dropped drastically from 61.1% on April 2, 2024, to 15.2% as of April 17, 2024. Currently, the market expects that the Fed will only start cutting interest rates in 3Q24, with only 1-2 cuts during 2024. Previously, the Fed projected 3 interest rate cuts in 2024. The negative impact of the 'higher for longer' narrative was also felt in Indonesia, marked by the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar which weakened to touch the 16,300 level on Wednesday (17/4) morning. Bank Indonesia itself has intervened in the spot and non-deliverable forward markets to maintain exchange rate stability. In October 2023, Bank Indonesia unexpectedly raised the BI Rate by 25 bps after the rupiah weakened to the 15,860 level, which was the lowest exchange rate since April 2020. Key Takeaway: The Fed's signal to delay US interest rate cuts potentially impacts the retreat of BI Rate cut expectations. Previously, the consensus of economists compiled by Bloomberg still projected that Bank Indonesia would start cutting the benchmark interest rate in 3Q24. The 'higher for longer' narrative also potentially has a negative impact on stocks in sectors sensitive to interest rates, such as banking, property, and technology. On the other hand, the strengthening of the US dollar could be positive news for issuers that have a significant portion of export sales, such as ITMG, ADRO, INKP, TKIM, MYOR, ICBP. Meanwhile, Indonesian government bond yields also increased alongside expectations that interest rates will remain high, with the 10-year government bond yield having risen 58 bps since the beginning of the year. Investors can take advantage of the opportunity to lock in more attractive yields on FR bond instruments (if held until maturity), such as the FR0097 series which achieved a yield of 7.05% per year as of April 17, 2024. Buy FR bonds via Bibit!

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia recorded that retail sales in Indonesia grew +1.7% MoM and +6.4% YoY in February 2024
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia recorded that retail sales in Indonesia grew +1.7% MoM and +6.4% YoY in February 2024 (vs. January 2024: -3.5% MoM and +1.1% YoY), supported by increased community activities during the Chinese New Year period, general elections, and Ramadan preparations. Bank Indonesia projects that retail sales in March 2024 will grow +4.1% MoM and +3.5% YoY.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia announced that the Consumer Confidence Index in March 2024 rose to 123.8
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia announced that the Consumer Confidence Index on March 2024 rose to 123.8 (vs. February 2024: 123.1).

marketNews.title: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Sets Indonesian Crude Price (ICP) for March 2024 at USD83.79 per Barrel
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Arifin Tasrif, set the average Indonesian Crude Price (ICP) for March 2024 at 83.79 US dollars per barel, an increase of 3.69 US dollars per barel from February 2024. This ICP increase was driven by the potential for tighter global supply following Ukrainian attacks on Russian oil refineries and a decrease in US crude oil stocks in mid-March 2024.

marketNews.title: Apple CEO Says Exploring Possibility of Building Manufacturing Facility in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Apple CEO, Tim Cook, said that they will explore the possibility of building a manufacturing facility in Indonesia. Apple currently produces most of its iPads, AirPods, Apple Watches, and MacBooks in Vietnam.

marketNews.title: Government Plans to Offer Mining Permits (IUP) to Community Organizations (Ormas) via Revision of Government Regulation No. 96 of 2021
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the government plans to grant Mining Business Permits (IUP) to community organizations (ormas) through the revision of Government Regulation No. 96 of 2021.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Trade Revises Trade Minister Regulation No. 36 of 2023 concerning Import Policies and Regulations
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Trade revised Trade Minister Regulation No. 36 of 2023 concerning Import Policies and Regulations. In the revision contained in Trade Minister Regulation No. 3 of 2024, the government no longer limits the quantity and type of goods brought from abroad. Instead, the government limits the value of goods to a maximum of 1,500 US dollars per year to be exempted from import duties, VAT, luxury good sales tax, and Income Tax.

tickerNews.title: TINS Targets Revenue Growth Up To +75% YoY in 2024
tickerNews.content: Company Secretary of Timah, Abdullah Umar, said that the company targets revenue growth of 70-75% YoY in 2024. To achieve this target, TINS seeks to boost sales volume to the export market, considering that the tin price on the London Metal Exchange has risen +25.2% YTD. TINS itself targets a production volume of 30 thousand tons in 2024, an increase of about +100% YoY from the 2023 realization.

tickerNews.title: Archi Indonesia Announces Temporary Suspension of Mining Activities Due to Natural Disaster
tickerNews.content: Archi Indonesia announced that mining activities in one of the pits owned by its subsidiaries, PT Meares Soputan Mining and PT Tambang Tondano Nusajaya, were temporarily halted due to disruptions from natural disasters of flooding and landslides. The natural disaster was caused by heavy rain for more than 24 hours in North Minahasa Regency and Bitung City, North Sulawesi, on April 6-7, 2024. ARCI stated that this incident has the potential to hamper mining activities in the related pits and the company's cash flow during the repair process.

tickerNews.title: TMAS Targets New Contract Growth of +8-10% YoY in 2024 with Revenue Target of Rp 5 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Company Secretary of Temas, Marthala Vigita, said that the company targets new contract growth of +8-10% YoY in 2024, with a revenue target growing +16.3% YoY to the level of 5 trillion rupiah. For 2024, TMAS allocates capex of 1.3 trillion rupiah (vs. 2023 allocation: 1 trillion rupiah), with 20-30% of it for decarbonization business expansion through its subsidiary, PT Temas Energy.

tickerNews.title: Nusantara Infrastructure Controlling Shareholder Extends Voluntary Tender Offer Period
tickerNews.content: The controlling shareholder of Nusantara Infrastructure, PT Metro Pacific Tollways Indonesia, announced the extension of the voluntary tender offer period until May 17, 2024, at 16:00 WIB. Previously, the META voluntary tender offer schedule ran from March 19 to April 17, 2024. Payment to shareholders who have submitted the voluntary tender offer form by April 17, 2024, will still be made on April 24, 2024.

tickerNews.title: DOID's Subsidiary Signs Contract for Pre-strip Mining Services in Australia
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur announced that its business entity, BUMA Australia Pty. Ltd., has signed a contract with Blackwater Operations Pty. Ltd. to provide pre-strip mining services. The value of the contract was not disclosed. DOID stated that the contract is predicted to provide a significant contribution to BUMA Australia's revenue until June 2026, with an average annual production of approximately 36 million bcm of overburden removal.
